In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia programming language:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    wrapped_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word length exceeds text width")
        end
        
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width 
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= word * " "
    end
    
    return wrapped_str
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("This is a test string to wrap", 15))
```
In this function, we first split the input string into words. Then for each word, if it exceeds `text_width`, an error will be thrown. After that, if adding the current word would exceed `text_width` (by checking the length of `wrapped_str`), a newline is added to start a new line. Finally, we append the current word and a space to `wrapped_str`.

The example usage wraps the string "This is a test string to wrap" with a maximum width of 15 characters per line.
